channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Biden Cuts Intel’s Chip Award

item.title: AI boom drives shares of sleepy Texas land firm up 200%
item.description: Texas Pacific Land Corp. owns nearly 900,000 acres in energy-rich West Texas, an area greater in size than Yosemite National Park.

item.title: Fentanyl Rises Again, This Time as Trump’s Diplomatic Weapon Against China

item.title: New Obesity Drug MariTide Helps Patients Lose Up to 20% of Weight, Early Data Shows
item.description: The drug, which is named MariTide and delivered in a monthly injection, is some time from being sold.

item.title: Emergency Crews Walk 14 Hours to Save Sole Survivor of Costa Rica Plane Crash
item.description: Rescue workers trekked overnight across a remote mountain forest carrying a woman who had survived a crash that killed five of the six people aboard.

item.title: Marc Andreessen doesn’t want to see anyone’s ‘whole self’ at work: ‘Act like a professional and a grownup’
item.description: It comes as a number of workplaces, like Meta and EY, have come down hard on staffers they feel aren’t acting professionally.

item.title: Pizza Hut is offering deep-fried frog pizza in China
With stakeholder capitalism pioneers Schwab, Dimon, and Fink nearing retirement, who will carry the torch forward?
item.description: We can start by viewing business as the very human institution that it is.

item.title: Breyten Breytenbach, Dissident South African-Born Writer, Dies at 85

item.title: Uniswap offers biggest-ever ‘bug bounty,’ promises up to $15.5 million to those who spot code vulnerabilities
item.description: The company is asking the public to seek out vulnerabilities in its v4 protocol.
